titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Kevin Roche John Dinkeloo and Associates Records
Kevin Roche John Dinkeloo and Associates Records
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Linda Scinto and Laura Tatum and staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday April 24, 2019 at 07:16

did.unittitle: Kevin Roche John Dinkeloo and Associates records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers are comprised of drawings, photographs, correspondence, specifications, and publicity materials generated by Kevin Roche John Dinkeloo and Associates in the process of designing buildings, both built and unbuilt. Major projects include the New Haven Veterans Memorial Coliseum, the Oakland Museum, the Knights of Columbus Headquarters in New Haven, Connecticut, and several projects in New York City, including the Ford Foundation Headquarters, the United Nations Plaza, and the Central Park Zoo. Also included are interviews conducted by Susan O'Keefe with Kevin Roche and others, notes and bibliographic index cards.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Kevin Roche, John Dinkeloo and Associates

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The papers are arranged by job number. Please consult the project index to access individual boxes. The addition is arranged by topic.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright interests in the collection materials held by Kevin Roche John Dinkeloo and Associates have been transferred by the donor to Yale University. Nonetheless, the collection materials may contain content owned by third-party copyright holders. Determination of the copyright status of specific material may require extensive research and it is the responsibility of researchers and others intending to use the materials to secure permission of the appropriate copyright holder(s). All other uses not requiring permission of third-party copyright holders are permitted only in accordance with the restrictions and requirements specified herein.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Kevin Roche, 2007-2013 and 2015-2016; Will Miller, 2010; Pelli Clarke Pelli Architects, 2011, ASSA ABLOY, 2011.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Kevin Roche John Dinkeloo and Associates Records (MS 1884). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: For a list of projects and the boxes in which project materials are located, please consult the Project Index.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Kevin Roche John Dinkeloo and Associates in Hamden, Connecticut is a direct outgrowth of Eero Saarinen and Associates, which was originally established in 1950. When Eero Saarinen died in September 1961, the practice was taken over by Kevin Roche and John Dinkeloo with Kevin Roche resolving the remaining design issues of the twelve major projects on which Mr. Saarinen had been working at the time of his death. These included the Dulles International Airport, the St. Louis Gateway Arch, and the CBS Headquarters in New York. In 1966 the firm became Kevin Roche John Dinkeloo and Associates (KRJDA).

KRJDA has completed over 200 projects throughout the United States, Europe, and Asia. Kevin Roche, recipient of the Pritzker Prize in 1982, has designed a variety of institutional and corporate projects including 38 corporate headquarters, three hotel/apartment buildings, eight museums, numerous research facilities, theaters, schools, factories, performing arts centers, houses and the Central Park Zoo in New York. Since 1967, he has been the architect for the master plan and expansion of the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York, designing all of its new wings and installing many of its collections. Source: Kevin Roche John Dinkeloo and Associates

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers are comprised of drawings, photographs, correspondence, specifications, and publicity materials generated by Kevin Roche John Dinkeloo and Associates in the process of designing buildings, both built and unbuilt. Major projects include the New Haven Veterans Memorial Coliseum, the Oakland Museum, the Knights of Columbus Headquarters in New Haven, Connecticut, and several projects in New York City, including the Ford Foundation Headquarters, the United Nations Plaza, and the Central Park Zoo. The 2012-M-042 addition to the papers consist of interviews conducted by Susan O'Keefe with Kevin Roche and others, notes and bibliographic index cards.
